document_data.name: Festival of the Pearl
document_data.mainbody: The '''Festival of the Pearl'''  was a yearly celebration that occurred in [[Gana]] within the [[Pearl Cities]] of [[west Zakhara]].
document_data.Location: Gana hosted the Festival of the Pearl every year.
document_data.Activities: Accounts between sailors, divers, and captains were settled and the sultan and mosque officials distributed a great feast among the people of Gana. Celebrants danced in the streets, shot skyrockets into the air and even broke the [[Law of the Loregiver|law]] by acting lewd and inebriated on public streets. This behavior made outsiders regard Gana as a "wild city."
document_data.History: This three day celebration was held annually following the close of the pearl season. The end of the Festival of the Pearl marked the beginning of the [[Great Task of the Pearl]].
